message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using household survey data from the LSMS, we investigate the relationship between agricultural productivity and poverty in rural areas of Mozambique.", "dataset": ["LSMS"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on a dataset of national prices collected using standardized methods by the International Comparison Program (ICP).", "dataset": ["International Comparison Program (ICP)"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combine firm-level data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys with a novel dataset of nighttime lights to investigate the relationship between power outages and firm performance in India.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "novel dataset of nighttime lights"], "topic": ["Energy", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we use cross-country data on health expenditures obtained from the WHO Global Health Expenditure Database and assess the impact of fiscal decentralization on health outcomes in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["WHO Global Health Expenditure Database"], "topic": ["Governance", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Our results are based on panel data from 20 African countries collected over a 27-year period by the Afrobarometer project.", "dataset": ["Afrobarometer project"], "topic": ["Governance", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "The analysis is based on a unique, nationally representative household survey dataset collected in Nigeria in 2018.", "dataset": ["household survey dataset collected in Nigeria in 2018"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the DEMETER project, which provides daily gridded estimates of precipitation and temperature for the African continent at a resolution of 0.1 degrees.", "dataset": ["DEMETER project"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we investigate the relationship between access to finance and firm performance in Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We use a unique dataset of refugee camps from the UNHCR and satellite images from the European Space Agency to assess the impact of conflict on urbanization and environmental degradation.", "dataset": ["UNHCR", "European Space Agency"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Urban Development", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on household survey data from the IPUMS-DHS program, which harmonizes population census and survey data from over 90 countries.", "dataset": ["IPUMS-DHS program"], "topic": ["Gender", "Education"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "Using household survey data from the LSMS, we investigate the relationship between agricultural productivity and poverty in rural areas of Mozambique.", "dataset": ["LSMS"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on a dataset of national prices collected using standardized methods by the International Comparison Program (ICP).", "topic": ["Gender", "Education"]} ]
